title: Ticket #2946: Enforce strict FIFO of parallel jobs even with remote submission
description:
The Dedicated Scheduler runs parallel jobs in a FIFO manner. However, when jobs are submitted remotely, and their input is spooled, the dedicated scheduler will only run the jobs that have finished spooling their input. Therefore, it is possible that a job with a later cluster id will be ready to run before a job with an earlier cluster ids.

This will introduce a parameter that will cause very strict FIFO even in this case -- idle dedicated jobs will wait for earlier jobs to finish spooling before being considered to run.
remarks:
2012-Sep-26 13:40:51 by tstclair:
commit here.. is this done?

2013-May-20 14:55:43 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Logic of the patch seems flawed. Patch has 

ClassAd *spoolingInJob = GetJobByConstraint(fifoConstraint.c_str());
if (spoolingInJob) {
   spoolingInJob->LookupInteger(ATTR_CLUSTER_ID, cluster_causing_skippage);
}

The above code will find some cluster that meets the fifo constraint, but will not find the smallest cluster that meets the fifo constraint. Seem like as written, the patch will fail to work correctly if three jobs are submitted (job 1.0, 2.0, 3.0) and lets say 1.0 and 3.0 are still spooling. Isn't it possible that job 2.0 will be able to run if GetJobByConstraint() happens to return 3.0 ? Shouldn't the code patch iterate through all the jobs that match the constraint and store the one with the lowest cluster id?

Also there are no documentation commits for this ticket. (or regression tests).

2013-May-20 17:24:43 by gthain:
HOWTO reproduce:

in the condor_config, set 

DEDICATED_SCHEDULER_WAIT_FOR_SPOOLER = true

Spin up a personal condor, and submit several parallel jobs. Put them all on hold with a HoldReasonCode of 16 (HOLD_CODE_SpoolingInput) 

$condor_hold -a
$condor_qedit gthain HoldReasonCode 16

Then, submit a new parallel job, and check for the following message in the SchedLog: 

05/20/13 17:22:45 (pid:11678) Job 377.0 is spooling input files, will block all 381.0 until spooling completes
05/20/13 17:22:45 (pid:11678) Job 377.0 is spooling input files, will block all 379.0 until spooling completes
05/20/13 17:22:45 (pid:11678) Found no idle dedicated job(s)

Release all the job, making sure to first set the hold code to something other than 16, so that condor_release will work, and watch the jobs match and run.

2013-May-21 11:38:07 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW #2

[35771] looks good, thanks. Note that [35771] is being released in v8.0.0.

Switching ticket to docpending...

2013-May-23 10:58:26 by gthain:
and docs are complete
